page.title: 08Recreation-Plumstead Library
page.content: The Plumstead Library has 16,583 books. The library has a section of adults books , a children's area, and there is also a section for young adults. The library is financed by the County Council. Pensioners do not have to pay fines for overdue books. The library is open 30 hours a week. Some of the library's rules are that you must not spit and lay on the floor. Two people work in the library at the same time, one is Mr. Wallis. The books are mainly hardbacks as they last longer. The most popular adult's books are written by Catherine Cookson. Some of the children's favourite authors are Roald Dahl and Enid Blyton. Children can take out three books and adults four. In the daytime it is often pensioners and mothers who use the library.
